intro: Anthospermum ciliare, commonly known as the threadleaf anthospermum, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves with fine cilia along the edges, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, often in dense inflorescences. Anthospermum ciliare is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
